latex: \textbf{T}wo ordered pairs $(a,b)$ and $(c,d)$, where $a,b,c,d$ are real numbers, form a basis of the coordinate plane if $ad \neq bc$. Determine the number of ordered quadruples $(a,b,c)$ of integers between $1$ and $3$ inclusive for which $(a,b)$ and $(c,d)$ form a basis for the coordinate plane.
